urlText: Double Bay wharf temporary closure
content:
The F7 Double Bay ferry service will not stop at Double Bay Wharf from Tuesday 13 June, while the wharf is upgraded.
 
The closure will continue for approximately six months until November 2023.
 
Alternative transport options include nearby buses, trains at Edgecliff Station and ferries from Darling Point Wharf.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Leppington and Glenfield
content:
Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 November
  • Buses replace trains between Leppington and Glenfield.
  • Trains run between Schofields and Liverpool, to the normal timetable.

  • Saturday, early morning and late night trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond and Olympic Park, making extra stops at Granville and Lidcombe. Change trains at Granville or Lidcombe to continue your journey.

  • Sunday, early morning and late night trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond and Macarthur. Change trains at Parramatta to continue your journey towards Central.

  • From 5.50am to 8.45am, buses replace trains between Richmond and Blacktown.

  • From 8.45am to 11am, buses replace trains between Richmond and Schofields.
  • Trains run between Blacktown or Schofields and Liverpool, some to a changed timetable.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
9T2 Leppington, Edmondson Park then Glenfield and return
Sunday only
30T1 Richmond, then all stations to Schofields and return

urlText: Changes to M92 Parramatta to Sutherland bus route
content:
From Sunday 24 September, route M92 Parramatta to Sutherland will be split into two new routes:
  • 920 Parramatta-Bankstown
  • 960 Bankstown-Sutherland
Passengers travelling the full length of the route (Parramatta to Sutherland), will need to change buses at Bankstown.
  • 920 services depart from Bankstown Station Stand E
  • 960 services depart from Bankstown Station Stand B
All other stops remain the same.
 
For more information see the news story.
 
This change will improve journey time and reliability for passengers and will allow drivers to complete other routes impacted by driver shortages.
 
Plan your trip with Trip Planner or transport apps before you travel.
subtitle: Changes to M92 Parramatta to Sutherland bus route

urlText: L1 Dulwich Hill Line weekend full closure due to maintenance
content:
Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 November
  • Daily from 6am to 11pm, L1 Dulwich Hill Line light rail services will not run due to planned trackwork and maintenance works.
  • During this time, use alternative transport including:
    • Replacement bus services between Central Grand Concourse and Dulwich Hill,
    • Train services and regular bus services, in areas where applicable.
    • If possible, walk is an alternative transport option for travel between Central Station, Darling Harbour, and Pyrmont due to increased road traffic.
  • See the news story for more information. Allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner to see if your travel is affected.

urlText: T1 Western Line: Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern
content:
Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 November
  • Saturday, Penrith trains run to a changed timetable, making extra stops at Flemington and Burwood.
  • Richmond trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond and Olympic Park. Change trains at Lidcombe to continue your journey towards Central.

  • Sunday, Penrith trains run to a changed timetable, making extra stops at Flemington, Homebush and Burwood.
  • Richmond trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond and Macarthur. Change trains at Parramatta to continue your journey towards Central.

  • From 5.50am to 8.45am, buses replace trains between Richmond and Blacktown.

  • From 8.45am to 11am, buses replace trains between Richmond and Schofields.
  • Trains run between Blacktown or Schofields and Macarthur, to a changed timetable.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
30T1 Richmond, then all stations to Schofields and return
50T1 Richmond, then all stations to Blacktown and return
57T1 Schofields, then all stations to Blacktown and return

urlText: Pyrmont bus diversions for Sydney Streets event
content:
Saturday 11 November
  • From 8am until 11.30pm, route 389 services will be diverting and missing stops while road closures are in place for the City of Sydney’s Sydney Streets event along Harris St in Pyrmont.
  • Services towards the city will be diverting around Harris St via Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Bank St and Bowman St. Services towards Pyrmont will be diverting via Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Bank St and Bowman St.
  • Stops will be missed on Harris St between Bowman St and Allen St in both directions, use alternative stops further along Harris St or on Pirrama Rd and continue on foot.
  • Check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
Stops missed:
  • Union Square, Harris St (200924)
  • Harris St at Pyrmont Bridge Rd (200916)
  • Harris St opp Union Square (200913)
  • Harris St after Pyrmont Bridge Rd (200928)
  • John St Square, Harris St (200912)
Alternative Stops
  • Harris St at Bowman St (200934)
  • Harris St opp John St Square (200923)
  • Harris St at Allen St (200933)
subtitle: Pyrmont bus diversions for Sydney Streets event

urlText: Buses replace trains between Macarthur, Glenfield and Fairfield
content:
Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 November  
  • Buses replace trains between Macarthur, Glenfield and Fairfield.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern between Fairfield and the City via Granville, and between Leppington and the City via the Airport.
  • Buses also replace trains on the T3 Bankstown Line.

  • Saturday from 6.30am to 10.30am, buses replace Inner West trains between Ashfield and Central.
  • Fairfield trains make extra stops at Homebush and Croydon.
  • T1 Western Line trains make an extra stop at Burwood and Ashfield.
  • You may need to change trains to continue your journey.

  • Saturday from 6pm to 2am, buses also replace trains between Leppington and East Hills.
  • Trains run between East Hills and the City, some to a changed timetable.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
 
Bus routes
79T2 Macarthur, then all stations to Fairfield and return
80T2 Fairfield, then all stations to Liverpool and return
 
Saturday morning only
45T2 Ashfield, Summer Hill, then express to Newtown, Macdonaldtown, then Central and return
46T2 Ashfield, all stations to Central and return
50T2 Lewisham, Petersham, Stanmore, then express to Central and return
 
Saturday night only
22T2 Leppington, then Edmondson Park, Glenfield, Holsworthy and East Hills and return
71T8 Campbelltown, Minto, Ingleburn, Glenfield then East Hills and return
74T8 Macarthur, all stations to Glenfield then East Hills and return
 
Sunday night only
11T8 Campbelltown, then Minto, Ingleburn, Glenfield and return
subtitle: Buses replace trains between Macarthur, Glenfield and Fairfield

urlText: Buses replace trains between Scone and Maitland
content:
Tuesday 21 to Thursday 23 November
  • 4am Tuesday to 10pm Thursday, buses replace trains between Scone and Maitland.
  • Trains between Dungog, Maitland and Newcastle Interchange may run to a changed timetable.

  • Tuesday and Wednesday, nightly from 7.20pm to 4.30am, buses replace all trains between Scone, Dungog and Newcastle Interchange.
  • Buses also replace the 18:01 Maitland to Dungog service.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
1HU Newcastle Interchange, then all stations to Telarah and return
4HU Dungog, all stations to Maitland and return

stations to Newcastle Interchange and return

urlText: Trains run between Liverpool or Lidcombe and Sydenham
content:
Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 November
  • Trains run between Liverpool or Lidcombe and Sydenham only, some to a changed timetable.
  • T4 Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line trains run between Sydenham and Bondi Junction, with some making extra stops at St Peters and Erskineville.
  • Trackwork on the City Circle may also affect how you travel. If you are travelling to Circular Quay change at Town Hall for the light rail.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: Accessible entrance - Parramatta Wharf
content:
Construction at Parramatta Wharf will continue until mid-September. Passengers, particularly those less mobile or those travelling with prams, should note that due to construction of Charles Street Square there are alternative routes in place from the ferry to the City centre. While pedestrian routes are stair-free they are not fully accessible. Passengers may wish to consider other transport options for visiting Parramatta.

Read more about Charles St Square Upgrade
subtitle: Accessible entrance - Parramatta Wharf

properties.smsText: Accessible entrance - Parramatta Wharf
properties.speechText: The accessible entry and exit point between the wharf and Phillip St has been temporarily relocated via George Katter Lane. Construction at Parramatta Wharf will continue until mid-September. Passengers, particularly those less mobile or those travelling with prams, should note that due to construction of Charles Street Square there are alternative routes in place from the ferry to the City centre. While pedestrian routes are stair-free they are not fully accessible. Passengers may wish to consider other transport options for visiting Parramatta.Â Customers are advised to check signage in place and if you need help ask staff on-board or via the help point on site.

urlText: Sydney CBD: Bus diversions
content:
On Sunday 12 November, between 1.30pm and 4pm, bus services will be diverting away from Elizabeth St and Park St due to a planned protest march in the city. 
 
Bus stops will be missed and alternative stops may be used.
 
Passengers can consider using the light rail to get around within the city or connect with buses at Randwick, Kingsford or Bondi Junction.
 
Buses also replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction. Please note:
  • Rail replacement buses do not stop at Martin Place.
  • Rail replacement buses that run to Town Hall will be diverting to The Domain.
  • If changing between trains and buses, please use stops on Macquarie St at Martin Pl, College St at The Domain or change at Central – Eddy Ave.
  • Route 324 bus services to Town Hall will be terminating/commencing from The Domain.
Alternative bus stops:
  • QVB stand A (Stop ID: 200041)
  • Martin Pl Stand C (Stop ID: 2000421)
  • Martin Pl Stand E (Stop ID: 2000283)
  • Park St Stand G (Stop ID: 2000426)

urlText: City Circle: Trackwork may affect how you travel
content:
Monday 13 November
  • From 9.50pm to 11.55pm, trains run in one direction only, from Central first stop Museum.

  • From 11.55pm to 1.30am, trains run in one direction only, from Central first stop Town Hall.
  • Some trains may start or end at Central, run to a changed timetable or leave from different platforms.
  • You may need to change trains to continue your journey.
  • The light rail runs in both directions between Circular Quay, Wynyard, Town Hall and Central.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Strathfield and Hornsby
content:
Monday 13 to Thursday 16 November
  • Nightly from 11pm to 3am, trains run to a changed timetable via the T1 North Shore Line, making extra stops at Gordon, Chatswood, then all stations to Central.
  • Buses run between Strathfield and Hornsby to connect with Central Coast & Newcastle Line trains.
  • Some trains towards Newcastle Interchange run up to 30 minutes later than the normal timetable.

  • Tuesday to Friday, the 1.47am Central to Newcastle Interchange train will start from Hornsby at 2.23am.
  • A bus leaves Central at 1.21am, running express to Hornsby to connect with this train.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: Brighton-Le-Sands bus diversions due to summer traffic changes
content:
From 8pm to 5am each Friday, Saturday and Sunday night from 29 September 2023 through until 1 April 2024 there will be a no right-turn restriction from Bay St to The Grande Pde.
 
Route 478 services towards Ramsgate will divert around a section of Bay St via Moate Ave, Bestic St then re-join The Grand Pde to continue on normal route. No stops will be missed. Services towards Rockdale will not be affected and will run per normal route.
 
See the Bayside Council website for more information.
subtitle: Brighton-Le-Sands bus diversions due to summer traffic changes

urlText: Buses replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction
content:
Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 November  
  • Buses replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Cronulla or Waterfall and North Sydney. Change at Town Hall for express buses to Bondi Junction.
  • All Cronulla and some Waterfall trains make extra stops at St Peters and Erskineville.
  • Trackwork buses do not leave from Martin Place Station. Buses leave from nearby bus stops or you can catch the light rail to Town Hall or Central.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
20T4 Bondi Junction, Edgecliff, Kings Cross, then Central and return (bypassing Martin Place)
23T4 Bondi Junction, then Town Hall and return
324 City, Walsh Bay to Watsons Bay via Old South Head Rd
- Town Hall (Park St), Kings Cross, Edgecliff and return
subtitle: Buses replace trains between Central and Bondi Junction

urlText: City Circle: Trackwork may affect how you travel
content:
Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 November
  • Trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay.
  • T1 North Shore & Western and T9 Northern Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall and Wynyard.
  • T4 Eastern Suburbs Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall, Martin Place and Kings Cross.
  • The light rail runs between Central and Circular Quay.
  • If you are travelling to:
    • Circular Quay, change at Wynyard for the light rail or walk
    • Museum or St James, change at Central or Town Hall for local buses or walk
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

• 4am Saturday 18 November to 10pm Sunday 19 November 2023, and
